Acute delirium generally includes positive psychotic symptoms ([[Delusional ideas SD-124|delusional ideas]] and [[Hallucinations SD-122|hallucinations]]). Other symptoms may be associated:

* Symptoms of psychotic disorganisation
* Negative psychotic symptoms
* Depressive or manic symptoms

question.title: What are the symptoms of acute delirium?
question.description: Select all the symptoms of acute delirium.

option_a.title: Delusional ideas and hallucinations
option_a.description: Delusional ideas and hallucinations are the primary symptoms of acute delirium.

option_b.title: Depressive and manic symptoms
option_b.description: Depressive and manic symptoms are not typically associated with acute delirium.

option_c.title: Psychotic disorganisation and negative symptoms
option_c.description: Psychotic disorganisation and negative symptoms are common in acute delirium.

option_d.title: All of the above
option_d.description: Not all of the above statements are correct symptoms of acute delirium.
